page.title: 18Agriculture in the area
page.content:
To the S and W of{Shottisham}the land is managed under the farm estate system with some large fields for grain crops and sugar beet.Small fields are used for grazing and crops such as potatoes.The estate is managed from a Farm Office at Sutton Street and is owned by Sir Antony Quilter of Sutton Hall. The land around Shott. Creek has been extensively drained and is farmed by Shott. Hall Farms. North of Shott. is the Vale Farm Estate, managed for J+S Pauls ltd.,a less open area with medium size fields.
S of{Waldringfield},as well as the {Hemley Saltings},the land is privately owned by Hemley Hall Farm,with mainly arable and grain crops.North of Wald. is more arable farmland.
